newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea indicts President Kim Young-sam's son.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea indicts President Kim Young-sam's son.

text.p: South Korean state prosecutors said on Thursday they had indicted President Kim Young-sam's second son on tax evasion and bribery charges.
Prosecutors said Kim Hyun-chul had received 6.61 billion won ($7.42 million) from businessmen, of which 3.22 billion was a bribe accepted in exchange for favours.
Prosecutors said Kim evaded 1.48 billion won in taxes.
Under Korean law, Kim could be jailed for life for tax evasion. Bribery carries a maximum sentence of five years in jail.

South Korea's "crown prince", as he is known, was charged with taking kickbacks in return for business favours from two alumni of his old high school, one a former top executive of a construction company.

The May 17 arrest of the president's son dramatically brought to a head a loans-for-kickback scandal involving top politicians, bankers and businessmen that emerged from the rubble of the country's biggest bankruptcy in January.
